alert.note: Alert for Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 12:45PM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Quad Cities IA IL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Illinois...Iowa... Mississippi River at Le Claire LD14 affecting Scott and Rock Island Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is expected in the next 7 days. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Le Claire LD14. * WHEN...From Friday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Water affects the lowest residences at the upstream end of town in Hampton. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Friday evening and continue rising to 12.4 feet Monday morning. Rises are expected to continue until at least the end of April. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
